acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 72-hour ErC50=44mg/L of algae (Scenedesmus) (SIDS, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 4 with the value of rabbit LD50= 1ml/kg (reduced value: 890mg/kg) (ACGIH (2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Rat Inhalation LC50: 4600mg/m3 (equivalent of 960ppm) (SIDS (2003)), 4500mg/m3 (equivalent of 940 ppm) (ACGIH (2001)), and 945ml/m3 (equivalent of 945ppm) (DFGOT vol.14 (2000)). Since the saturated vapor pressure concentration at 20degC is less than 1777ppm, they are considered to be inhalation steam tests. Therefore, it was classified as Category 3.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
SPECIES: Rat
ENDPOINT: LD50
VALUE: 1320 mg/kg
REFERENCE SOURCE: SIDS(2003)

aspiration_hazard.rationale: No data available on chemical pneumonia

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was information (SIDS (2003)) that it was not carcinogenicity (SIDS (2003)). But there was no information of evaluation organizations, so it was determined that it cannot be classified.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since rapidly degrading (22-day decomposition rate of the OECD test guideline 301A: 95% (SIDS, 2002)), and less bio-accumulative (BCF<6.1 (Existing Chemicals Safety Check Data)).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: No data available on corrosion to metals

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: The substance was regarded as outside the categories because there is a negative result in the in vivo mouse micronucleus test (SIDS (2003)).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: The ignition points is 250 degC and it is thought that in room temperatures it does not ignite.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Since there was no bad effect to genitalia in rat inhalation test 365mg/m3(14week) (SIDS (2003)), there was no development disorder in 486 mg/m3 inhalation administration to pregnancy rat (SIDS (2003)), and there was no effect to teratogenesis, embryo toxicity, and ferotoxity in inhalation toxicity of rat(DFGOT vol.14(2000)), they were considered as on the outside of Categry according to these information.

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitization is uncategorizable because of no information.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since there is the conclusion data of "critical damage over an eye" (CERI Hazard Data (2001)) and it was set to Category 1C on the skin, it was set as Category 1.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since corrosivityity is verified in an examination (4 hours) on rabbits under OECD guideline 404 (SIDS (2003)), it was classified as Category 1C.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Uncategorizable because there are data that indicate sensitization in guinea pig skin(CERI Hazard Data (2001)) and that find no sensitization in guinea pigs (SIDS (2003))

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 since liver disease was observed in rat with 100mg/kg diet (ACGIH (2001)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 (whole body) since "nausea and vomiting" are observed in human cases (DFGOT vol.14 (2000), SIDS (2003), ACGIH (2001)).
